      • getIndexAbove

        public int getIndexAbove(double xValue)
        Description copied from interface: SampledContinuousFunction
        Find the nearest index with a value on the domain above the value given.
        Specified by:
        getIndexAbove in interface SampledContinuousFunction
        Parameters:
        xValue - The value we wish to find the nearest greater sampled neighbour to.
        Returns:
        The index of the sample adjacent and above the given value, or -1 if no such sample exists.

      • getRange

        public uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.Range<Double> getRange()
        Description copied from interface: ContinuousFunction
        An interval containing all values in the codomain of the function. Some implementations may not quickly be able to calculate the smallest such interval, in which case they should return a close approximation guaranteed, to contain the exact smallest interval.
        Specified by:
        getRange in interface ContinuousFunction
        Specified by:
        getRange in interface SampledContinuousFunction
        Returns:
        The extent of the codomain

      • resample

        public SampledContinuousFunction resample(double startX,
                                          double endX,
                                          int resolvableUnits)
        Description copied from interface: ContinuousFunction
        Sometimes it is useful to linearise a continuous function in order to perform complex processing, or for display purposes. This method provides a linear view of any continuous function. Implementations may remove features which are unresolvable at the given resolution.
        Specified by:
        resample in interface ContinuousFunction
        Specified by:
        resample in interface SampledContinuousFunction
        Parameters:
        startX - The start of the interval we wish to sample over
        endX - The end of the interval we wish to sample over
        resolvableUnits - The minimum resolvable units within the given interval
        Returns:
        A new sampled, linear continuous function roughly equal to the receiver to the requested resolution
